title: Quasi-universal behaviour of shear relaxation times in simple fluids
authors: S. A. Khrapak and A. G. Khrapak
abstract:
We calculate the shear relaxation times in four important simple monatomic
model fluids: Lennard-Jones, Yukawa, soft-sphere and hard-sphere fluids. It is
observed that in properly reduced units, the shear relaxation times exhibit
quasi-universal behaviour when the density increases from the gas-like low
values to the high-density regime near crystallization. They first decrease
with density at low densities, reach minima at moderate densities, and then
increase toward the freezing point. The reduced relaxation times at the minima
and at the fluid-solid phase transition are all comparable for the various
systems investigated, despite more than ten orders of magnitude difference in
real systems. Important implications of these results are discussed.
